info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 4:40AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WAYNE, UNION, FRANKLIN, AND DEARBORN COUNTIES IN INDIANA, AND PORTIONS OF PREBLE, BUTLER, AND HAMILTON COUNTIES IN OHIO THROUGH 515 AM EDT... At 440 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hagerstown to near Moores Hill, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Oxford, Harrison, Brookville, Centerville, Bright, Hidden Valley, Ross, Liberty, New Paris, Fountain City, West College Corner, Taylor Creek, Blue Jay, Dry Ridge, Dunlap, Salem, Logan, Reily and New Haven. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 140 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 159 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
